summary: This FBI 302 form documents an interview with Dr. Kari Schlessinger, a forensic psychologist for the Bureau of Prisons, conducted on August 30, 2019. It details her intake interview with Jeffrey Epstein on July 8, 2019, and her presence at a meeting on August 9, 2019, where Epstein's attorney opposed him having a cellmate. The document is part of the investigation following Epstein's death.

persons.name: Kari Schlessinger
persons.role: Forensic Psychologist for Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI/OIG regarding her psychological evaluations of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. She conducted his intake interview on July 8, 2019, and was present at a meeting on August 9, 2019, regarding his cellmate status.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of Dr. Schlessinger's intake interview and the August 9, 2019 meeting. He denied any mental health, suicide, or substance abuse history during his intake.

persons.name: Adam Johnson
persons.context: Present with Dr. Schlessinger at the August 9, 2019 meeting. He explained to Epstein's attorney the rationale for Epstein requiring a cellmate.

persons.name: Dr. Miller
persons.context: Dr. Schlessinger was acting on his behalf during the August 9, 2019 meeting regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Dr. Schlessinger conducted a forensic psychological intake evaluation of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 8, 2019.
Adam Johnson, as BOP staff, was involved in a meeting discussing Epstein's cellmate status and the policy requiring him to have one.
Both were present and jointly explained BOP policy to Epstein's attorney during the August 9, 2019 meeting.
Dr. Schlessinger was acting on behalf of Dr. Miller during the August 9, 2019 meeting regarding Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Psychological Intake Interview
events.description: Dr. Kari Schlessinger conducted a forensic psychological intake evaluation of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Epstein denied any history of mental health issues, suicide attempts, or substance abuse.

events.title: Meeting on Epstein's Cellmate Status
events.description: A meeting was held regarding Jeffrey Epstein's detention conditions. Epstein's attorney opposed him having a cellmate. BOP staff Adam Johnson and Dr. Schlessinger explained that, as a sex offender in the Special Housing Unit ('shoe'), Epstein was required to have a cellmate.

events.title: FBI Interview of Dr. Schlessinger
events.description: The FBI and OIG interviewed Dr. Kari Schlessinger at the U.S. Attorney's Office in New York regarding her interactions with and evaluations of Jeffrey Epstein while he was in BOP custody.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, NY, 10007 (US Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: Dr. Kari Schlessinger conducted a psychological intake of Jeffrey Epstein on July 8, 2019, during which he denied any mental health, suicide, or substance abuse history.

On August 9, 2019, Epstein's attorney argued against him having a cellmate, but BOP staff (Adam Johnson and Dr. Schlessinger) stated policy required it because Epstein was a sex offender in the Special Housing Unit ('shoe').
The document clarifies that the potential release of Epstein's cellmate was NOT discussed during the August 9, 2019 meeting.
The interview of Dr. Schlessinger was conducted by the FBI and OIG on August 30, 2019, following Epstein's death, as part of their investigation.
The identities of the interviewing FBI SA, OIG SA, and AUSA are redacted in the document.
